name: Hotel David

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Florence for a short break. The hotel was really really really nice. Very clean and the staff were all very attentive and extremely polite. The breakfasts were delicious, and the happy hour/s of complimentary wine, juice and snacks were brilliant. A superbyly ran hotel with a lovely personal touch, we will definately be visting again very soon.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel David was a splurge for us on our trip to Italy in June 2008. It exceeded all our expectations.
reviews.title: Highly recommend Hotel David

likes.liked: — Great service, comfort, wonderful breakfast, great location
likes.disliked: — We liked everything about this accomodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was very comfortable and well appointed and included a sparkling bath with generous shower and fluffy towels.
reviews.title: Top service at this small and friendly hotel!

likes.liked: — The staff- probably the best service we've ever had!

reviews.title: Stolen Bag
reviews.text: But the best part was the lavish breakfast which included not just cereals and rolls, but also antipasto meat and cheese, coffee cakes and other sweets, fresh fruit salad or whole fruits and yogurt, and orange juice, coffee and tea. Everything was self serve and we were happy to be able to forego lunch and keep sight seeing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelers who enjoy American and British B&Bs will love Hotel David. In addition to the fabulous breakfasts, the hotel offers a happy hour with aperitifs, white and red wine, and snacks, served in the lounge or outdoors in the beautiful garden. We enjoyed sitting outside having a glass of wine and visiting with other hotel guests.
reviews.title: Warm And Welcoming Home Away From Home

likes.liked: — The warm and welcoming atmosphere generated by the hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (three adults) booked this hotel for three reasons, wifi internet, car park and close proximity to the main sights of Florence. We were no disappointed with any of them.
reviews.title: Just about right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: As we were driving, a secure car park was essential. Hotel David has a small car par inside its grounds. We left the car there and walked into Florence - an easy 30 min. stroll. If you had no car Bus D took you directly there and stopped outside the hotel. The other good thing was there was a cafe right next door and a restaurant across the road. The bad thing was that they were both closed on weekends! Restaurants in the area were not plentiful but a bit of walking around found us the lovely restaraunt Gigi.
reviews.title: From an American living In Italy

likes.liked: — The large comfortable bedroom and bathroom.

reviews.title: Our favourite hotel in Italy!!!!!
reviews.text: The hotel had a good free wifi connection, a lift (essential for a multi-storied place, a nice area to have drinks and nibbles (part of the tarrif) in the evening. This was a nice touch. The street had tall trees in leaf so it was lovely sitting outside. A main road runs by but the windows are double glazed to reduce traffic noise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, nicely appointed with a decent ensuite. Breakfast offered a variety of savories as well as sweet things to eat. Very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel David

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very courteous, hepful, knowledgeable and spoke excellent English.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thank you Hotel David! Very clean room and bath, excellent breakfast, great location. But most of all, and so important when traveling to a city for the first time (and you don't speak the language), the entire staff at the Hotel David were very helpful, patient, pleasant, and always gave me the best direction and advise. They definitely played a major part in making my 5 day stay in the beautiful city of Florence, a very wonderful experience.
reviews.title: A Pleasure with wonderful service and considerations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was by far the best hotel we stayed at in our 12 day tour of Italy. The best breakfast, best staff and best ammenities. Quiet location with a 15 minute walk to Realto. There are several good restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk. They have free wifi and free happy hour with wine and lots of really good snacks. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. They went above and beyond on every occasion. Parking is included. Rooms were very clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Quit searching - You found the one!

likes.liked: — The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Breakfst was yumy too.

reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed the Hotel David!
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent 5 nights at the Hotel David, and it offers a great value. All front desk employees are very helpful and speak fluent english. While the hotel is not in the center of Florence, the Hotel David is in a quiet & beautiful residential area and we were able to walk to the Ponte Vecchio and Piazza Michelangelo within 18 minutes. The hotel itself is more like a bed & breakfast than a traditional hotel, but it was very comfortable and very clean. And if you rent a car, it has on-site parking. Overall, we recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, just as we expected. Wonderful breakfast and great happy hour with snacks, juice and wine. On busy street in a great neighborhood. Freindly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a car, and parking it was easy and free on the hotel grounds behind a locked gate. Easy bus ride to all the standard Florence attractions.
reviews.title: Lovely, just as promised!

likes.liked: — very pretty setting, and so very clean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We thought the Hotel David was simply great. Its location gives you the best of two worlds - a short hop to the bustle of central Florence and then back to the quieter suburbs, to join "the happy hour". The hotel staff were brilliant, extremely helpful, friendly and efficient. Our room was large, clean and very comfortably furnished. The overall experience of staying in this hotel was extremely enjoyable and one that we would have no hesitation in repeating and recommending.
reviews.title: Hotel David - fantastico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Francis family - UK
reviews.title: Hotel David - bravo, bravo, bravo

likes.liked: — Large, clean air conditioned room and bath
likes.disliked: — cannot think of anything I didn't like!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 6 nights in Florence at the Hotel David - chose hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and Venere.com - was not disappointed. Spotlessly clean, large rooms, baths. Very helpful staff. Good Italian breakfast - great capaccino - early evening snacks - dry cleaning/laundry - 24 hour turn around - my husband is not a walker, but did the easy down hill 10-15 minute walk to Ponte Vecchio almost daily. Taxi service and bus service super close. Nice family run Trattoria L'Orologico across street . Lovely park right across bridge. Just wished we could have stayed longer! Would definitely recommend and return.
reviews.title: Been many times LOVE this hotel
Best hotel in Italy
reviews.text: We have been all around Italy and Florence with this hotel being one of the very nicest especially for the price. Just on the other side of the river and within bus or shoe leather express to the heart of Florence. I concur with the other reviews that the staff was most friendly and the rooms were spacious. We had the room that overlooked the small parking area, but not a sound was heard. We could see trees through our bedroom window which was nice rather than streets and other hotel walls. We had a nice balcony too. Definitely make this your hotel to stay in while in Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled for almost three weeks in Italy and this was our favorite hotel. Large rooms, great breakfast, friendly staff and close to town by the "D" or "23" bus. Wonderful courtyard with free evening refreshments. Great deli around the corner.
reviews.title: great place, charm and function

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel David for 3 nights of our honeymoon in September 2008 and our experience was delightful! The staff, especially Gabriele, was outstanding and really went the extra mile to make our stay enjoyable. We were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of wine and congratulatory note awaiting us in our room when we first checked in. They host a happy hour in the evening with wine and snacks in the courtyard. Talk about going the extra mile, they also offer international calls at no charge from the lobby!
reviews.title: Hotel David - #1 in our Book

likes.liked: — Service, spacious shower, clean & comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good, a quick and pleasant 10-15 minute walk from the town center. Or you can take the bus, which the staff is happy to help you figure out. Only a few minutes away via car is the Piazzale Michelangelo, which offers phenomonal views of Florence.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Hotel David is the best!
reviews.text: Our room was very clean, comfortable, and quiet. Of the 4 hotels we stayed at in Italy, Hotel David had the best bathroom and largest shower of them all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was good - they offer pastries, yogurt, ham, cheese, fruit, egg casseroles, etc. The blood orange juice was particularly notable.
reviews.title: Love this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and if you have a car - parking is free of charge! There is an elevator which is convenient for transporting your luggage up to your room (only 2 of the 4 hotels we stayed at had lifts). Our room had a safe which was easy to use. Lobby is stocked with guidebooks that you can borrow - we took one with us to explore Tuscany one day.
reviews.title: If you had thought that Italian Hotel Staff Were Always Rude......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel David. This was our third stay in this lovely hotel. As always we were not disappointed. The quality of service was far above excellent as always. They have been doing some renovatiions, including some lovely improvements to the bathroom in our room. We were fortunate enough to stay in the same room as on our last visit. There is a lovely terrace for sitting in the mornings or evenings. Everything was spotlessly clean with wonderfully crisp and sweet smelling bedding. I always sleep well when I stay at Hotel David!!
reviews.title: Wonderful again !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast again in the lovely breakfast room with Maria making wonderful capuccini has always been one of the highlight of our stays. There was a very good assortment of meats,cheeses,cereal,boiled eggs,rolls and delicious pastries along with the coffees and teas and juice. Maria herself is the gem of the breakfast room though !!
reviews.title: I'll stay here again

likes.disliked: — Wish we had a better view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire staff is always at hand to help us with all our travel needs. Bus schedules,train schedules,buying city bus tickets,restaurant recommendations and reservations,museum reservations--these are just a few of the services they provide with great detail and lovely smiles.
reviews.title: Loved This Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The computer in the lobby is a lifesaver for many of us !
reviews.title: A good find

likes.disliked: — wife found the bed hard - I thought it was fine.

reviews.title: loved the area
reviews.text: The early evening drinks and snacks in the parlour with a fire in the fireplace on cool evenings is another of the highlights of our stay at this hotel. We are always able to find other guests to talk to, to share ideas with and to learn from. This trip we even went to dinner with various people who were also staying there. One night we had a little "party" outside after dinner and they made cappucini and coffee for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was chosen by the Tripadviser as the best hidden gem in Florence and we took our chance. I would like to say thank you because this was a great boutique hotel and it made our stay excellent in Florence. It is 15 minutes walk to Ponte Vecchio, but your route is to walk by the Arno river, therefore it is great. People are very helpful and friendly. It has a beatiful small garden where you can have your wine when you come back to the hotel after your dinner.The very important thing is that the rooms and the bathroom are extremely clean. It is a house with around 20 rooms and with a very lovely lobby. Thank you thank you thank you... Definetely recommend to everyone...
reviews.title: Excellent hotel to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel to be excellent value. Very friendly and helpful owner and staff. Well furnished, felt like a country inn although just over the Arno river, a short bus ride from the centre of Florence. Books and magazines, a real sitting area for guests near the reception desk, and a very pleasant ending to a day's sightseeing with wine and aperitifs at 6:30. Comfortable beds, spacious room, parking on the property. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: everything as promised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: F & A, Vancouver
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel David two nights, 4/30 and 5/1. Nice sized room, nice sized bathroom WITH a BATHTUB! Had a small balcony with two chairs. Small parking area in front of hotel. Excellent, helpful staff. Approximately 15 minute walk to Ponte Vecchio or short bus ride. Hotel will even sell you a bus ticket to get into town and show you where to pick up the two buses that go by the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic find!
Full of character
reviews.text: Good breakfast with a nice variety of hams, cheeses, breads, pastries, teas, coffees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: A very generous man, who offers a home away from home experience.
reviews.title: Florence Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every night happy hour drinks on the patio is complimentary with hot savoury snacks, wine etc. Not many hotels offer this kind of atmosphere and the Hotel David are to be complimented on their approach to making every guest a very welcome member of a large family.
reviews.title: Amazing Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: A quiet area of Florence but within walking distance of the main attractions of Florence. We decided to take the bus, D Bus, as it is known. Piazzale Michaelangelo is nearby and gives a fantastic view over Florence.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The evening Happy Hour get together

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooms were tastfully decorated in typical Florentine decor as is the whole hotel. It is like an old family home converted into hotel rooms of which there are only 25.
reviews.title: Home away from home

likes.liked: — It was very warm, friendly and immaculately clean.

reviews.title: A Reason to Return to Florence
reviews.text: The best way I can describe my stay at the Hotel David is to say that this hotel is the reason that I'd like to return to Florence . . . well, this hotel and the local deals on leather goods.

likes.liked: — The hotel is clean, rooms are large and the staff is wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel David and we absolutely loved it. It is located across the river from the old city (10-15 minute walk from the Ponte Vecchio or 3 minutes by bus). The room we stayed in was very large, especially by European standards.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel With a Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and room was very clean. The air conditioner worked very well and we were never uncomfortable. The breakfast was awesome; the staff will make cappuccini for you and the food was very good.
reviews.title: We loved the Hotel David!

likes.liked: — comfort, cleanliness, great air-conditioning, wireless internet access, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were outstanding. Everyone from the property manager to the night clerk (whose name I can't remember) were very helpful. We must have had the girl working the night desk help us ten times over our stay and she was very polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Florence's Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is on a really neat property. They had free parking (which we didn't use) and a cool garden where they did a happy hour every day. The happy hour included red and white wine as well as little pizza bites and cocktail mixes. It was fun to come back after a day of walking everywhere and have some wine and snacks before heading out to dinner.
reviews.title: Loved It!!

likes.disliked: — Lack of an iron in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic period style hotel located about a 15 minute walk from the Duomo. The rooms are fantastic and very homely. Excellent friendly staff who were always willing to help in any way.
reviews.title: A home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: While the area around the hotel is mainly residential you can walk or get a bus into central Florence from right outside.
reviews.title: Super staff!
Great Stay at the Hotel David!
reviews.text: Highly recommended if you want a real break in a real hotel and not just another anonymous business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of our stay at the Hotel David was the staff. They helped us find a lively trattoria for dinner. They tried so very hard to help me recover my cell phone. They host a convivial, generous wine and snack event in the evenings. They juggle multiple guests' needs in the small check-in area with aplomb.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The second best part was the very fair price they charge for a room in Florence.
reviews.title: Simply outstanding!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled through Italy for our anniversary and stayed in Rome, Florence, and the Cinque de Terre areas (4 hotels in 10 days). Hotel David exceeded our expectations even though it had previous great reviews on Trip Advisor. It is confortable, beautiful, has great perks (evening snacks and wine, free use of PC's, free daily call home). The service couldn't have been friendlier and helpful. It was also a very good value (off season rates in October).
reviews.title: Best hotel of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to downtown Florence but the walk is along the river and very pleasant. The alternative to walking downtown is to walk to the bus stop a short block away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Firenze

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 3 very nice restaurants within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. These also represent very good values as they are not in downtown Florence.
reviews.title: BEST hotel, BEST experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The best scenic views of the area are a steep 15 minute walk from the hotel and is highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Spectacular Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Either train station has bus service to the hotel and cabs are less than $15 euro.
reviews.title: excellent service

reviews.title: Hotel David in Florence Italy.....AWESOME!

reviews.title: A wonderful oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: locations is wonderful. They serve a great breakfast, rooms are lovely & guest service was excellent!
reviews.title: A lovely hotel on the edge of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would highly recommend Hotel David for anyone traveling to Italy for their first visit
reviews.title: You won't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: or return visit....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel David was definately a gem that stands out among most of our other destinations throughout Italy. It came highly recommended to us from a friend, and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it as well!
reviews.title: A hotel you'd be happy to stay in!

likes.disliked: — A bit of a walk from the centre of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007
reviews.text: Staff is very friendly and helpful... they made reservations for the Uffizi and the Accedemia and to a great restaurant Aqua al 2 (also recommended!)
reviews.title: Overall, An Excelent Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is a a good walk away from the heart of the city. The walk from the hotel was beautiful along the river, although tired feet at the end of a long day made us wish it were just a bit closer.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the David!

likes.disliked: — The distance form the center of florence.

reviews.title: Hotel David
reviews.text: The hotel's free parking was appreciated and very convenient... although we found it a challenge (very frustrating) to navigate our car to the Hotel's parking lot at night. Surprisingly, leaving the hotel destined for the Autostrada was painless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed breakfast each morning in their bright room. Selection of food and beverages was quite good as well.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Hotel David after finding it the first time through trip advisor. If you are looking for a quaint hotel with character and exceptional staff, this is the place for you. Everyone goes out of their way to make sure your experience is the best it can be. We love this hotel!
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're from Canada and stayed for 3 nights at Hotel David from October 12-15. We read the reviews on tripadvisor before booking and decided to choose hotel David for the great reviews.
reviews.title: Hotel David - The Best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Are we still happy?? Absolutely. Family run hotel, great location. Nice walk to old Florence, beautiful decoration, Very clean. Service awsome. The staff goes out of their way to make your stay the best possible!. Nice rooms. Immaculate bathrooms. Quiet. Free breakfast, Free cocktail, Free parking, Free long distance call (1 hr/day.)
reviews.title: Outstanding! Don't stay anywhere else in Florence!

likes.disliked: — A bit of a walk in to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: What else do you need??? You will not find any better.
reviews.title: Soooo Great!
Best hotel we stayed at in 5 weeks touring
reviews.text: It is the best in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: An outstanding value, outstanding service, many personal touches and a beautiful hotel. The room was spacious and well appointed; the public areas were homey, welcoming and comfortable; the staff was helpful and gracious; any extra you need for a comfortable extended stay is offered with a smile, and on the house. An incredibly gracious host tops off what is a wonderful experience for a travelling family.
reviews.title: Super, Fantastic, Wonderful...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new wife and I recently stayed there on our honeymoon. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by Sabrina, who was charming, helpful and ebullient. There was a nightly complimentary happy hour which was already in progress (red and white wines , along with some fine finger foods).
reviews.title: Wonderful Gem Across the Arno

likes.liked: — Staff, Value, Spacious and Well-Maintained Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were quite pleased with our room. It was extremely spacious, spotless, with some tasteful art. We were also thrilled to see that the hotel ha left us a bottle of wine to enjoy as a congratulations upon getting married. The complimentary wi-fi came in very handy for getting ideas about what to do in Florence. There was also a complimentary 10 minutes of phone use anywhere in the world per night using Skype.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Hotel David

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Originally we were scheduled to stay only two nights in Florence, but we loved the city and the hotel so much we stayed an extra two nights as well.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

likes.disliked: — No tea/coffee making facilities in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel, while not ideal, is quite good overall. It is about a 20-25ish minute walk/stroll down the Arno river (a picturesque walk that I would recommend taking at least once when in Florence anyway) to get to Ponte Vecchio, the main pedestrian entryway to Florence. Alternatively, one can take a bus to Ponte Vecchio, for which the stop is just a block away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

likes.liked: — Almost everything about the Hotel David was great
likes.disliked: — location - it was not bad but is just a bit out of the centre of action in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights with my husband while we were traveling throughout Tuscany. The Hotel David is a little outside of downtown Florence, so there is a 15 min. walk downtown. Overall, this hotel was a great value. Friendly staff, good breakfast, clean rooms, free parking, and wifi.
reviews.title: Cozy and simple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything concerning this charming hotel is outstanding. My wife and I stayed four nights in September in a very spacious room on the third floor, with a great view of the Duomo. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Chiara. The hotel location is very convenient,
reviews.title: The hotel to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: everything in Florence is just a short bus ride away.
reviews.title: A favorite and what great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved this hotel. The location, outside the action was terrific, an easy walk to the main piazza but nice to leave the hectic pace and come back for happy hour. The hotel has a great happy hour for guests from 6:30 to 8:00 with free wine and snacks and it is really lovely. We met some very nice people there. The hotel gives you a nice welcome cake and free initial stocking of your mini bar which is unusual and greatly appreciated. The WIFI worked really well in the room which was very convenient. We will stay at this hotel again when in Florence for sure.
reviews.title: A home from home with everything for foreigners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small modern hotel with a well deserved reputation. Spent several nights here seeing Florence and the area around Florence. Rooms comfortable with all you need. Breakfast very good and sets you up for the day. Hotel very much aimed at foreigners. Reception and Management made sure they were happy and had all they needed including free calls home, aperitif in the evening to settle you back in peace and chat with new friends.
reviews.title: Excellence in hospitality
Favorite Italian Accomodation
reviews.text: Great place to stay...comfortable, friendly, and conveniently located.Our only problem was finding the place and it would have been easier if we had followed Hotel David's directions rather than MapQuest, which used the most direct, but less scenic route.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will happily recommend Hotel David to anyone looking for a great base to explore Florence from.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations

likes.liked: — Service, cleanliness, internet, evening aperitifs/ appetizer, breakfast
likes.disliked: — 1 mile walk into cente- but easily alleviated by short frequent bus ride

reviews.text: Chose the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great service & amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and helpful staff. Made reservations for us for Uffizi and Accademia
reviews.title: Very Nice Little Hotel - Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice room with charm - old character.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel & Experience

likes.liked: — Gracious, helpful staff and lovely rooms
likes.disliked: — challenging to find driving in from highway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: We spent one night at Hotel David and to be frank I wish it could have been longer! The hotel feels more like someone's house with its antique furniture and homely decor. Ideally located to the south-east of Florence it is a 20 minute walk into town however the area is well-serviced by buses for the less energetic.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean, cool and felt very cosy. Aside from the fantastic staff, it is the little things that Hotel David does so well. Nice touches such as the free internet and 10 minute phone call really set it apart. However the best feature has to be the 'aperitivo' on an evening where guests can sample free wine and nibbles in the garden,
reviews.title: If this is only number 3 what can the best 2 hotels in Florence be like!!

reviews.text: Hotel David was great! We stayed there with our 2 teenage daughters in a large room with 4 beds. The bathroom was big and very clean. The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked very well, which was important when we were there in July! Florence is SO hot in the summer! The hotel itself is lovely and filled with books and games in the lobby, and the grounds are beautiful to sit in in the evenings.
reviews.title: A Great Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have travelled a lot in Europe, and Hotel David offers the best overall experience. All the staff were friendly - the people at the reception, the cleaning ladies, the staff in the breakfast room. In addition we got excellent advice about were to eat, what to see and they also made a great effort to book the tickets we wanted.
reviews.title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel David in Florence (13 August to 16 August) during our 18 day trip to Italy. The Hotel David lived up to all of the accolades I had read on TripAdvisor. The hotel is located on the far side of the River Arno, a quick ten minute bus ride to downtown Florence. Bus stops are conveniently located just outside the hotel’s door and stop there every ten to 15 minutes. (The hotel even sells bus passes—so convenient).
reviews.title: The best hotel in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a large room with comfortable bathroom, where we enjoyed peace and quiet each evening. (No trouble getting to sleep there!). I should point out that a remote control allows you to regulate the air conditioning, so do be on the look-out for that item. It certainly comes in handy in August! We enjoyed our breakfast there – a traditional fare of breads, coffee, fruit, and cold cuts. And, their afternoon happy hour (5:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m.) was delightful. We enjoyed relaxing with a glass of wine on their outdoor patio with other guests.
reviews.title: A low cost gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Don’t miss a late afternoon stroll from the hotel to the top of Piazza Michelangelo to watch the sunset over Florence. You’re in for a real treat if you stay to see the sunset – something not to be missed. It’s only a ten minute walk (uphill) from the Hotel David.
reviews.title: If this hotel isn't perfection, I don't know what is!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is amazing and represents superb value. The staff are unbelievably friendly and helpful (they even baked us a special cake as we were getting married whilst out in Florence), the decor is great, our room was huge, they provide a free and very nice aperitif in the evenings and there's plenty of off-street parking to name just a few of the plus points. The hotel cannot be faulted in any way and we look forward to staying again!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We enjoyed an excellent week in this hotel. The family room was comfortable and spacious and the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. Breakfast was good value and was a good way to start the day. We also found the location to our liking; a short bus ride away and away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. All in all we felt at home and relaxed and this greatly enhanced our holiday. Other useful information is the presence of a fantastic deli around the corner who make delicious sandwiches on request for days out etc. I would strongly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 2 1/2 week trip to Italy, 2 nights of which we spent at Hotel David in Florence. We LOVED it! While the hotel is not directly located in the heart of the city, it's extremely close and easy to reach, both when arriving to the city (via car) and traveling to the historical district. It's a very short block from the Arno and on several public bus lines, so it's very very easy to get anywhere you'd like to go. If you're a walker, you can reach Ponte Vecchio in about 15 minutes, strolling along the river on a lovely paved path.
reviews.title: Wonderful & charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed at Hotel David from December 19 to December 21, 2007. As soon as we entered the hotel lobby, we smelled firewood and a staff welcomed us. This is not a big hotel; it is rather staying your friends/family's house. We stayed at Room 15, which is a family room. The room is quite big for 4 beds. They have a happy hour from 6 to 8, serving local wines, juice, and snacks. The bus stops are less than a minute walk from the hotel. Free internet service is provided at lobby.We really loved all staffs - they always had a big smile and wanted to help us for sightseeing and restaurant recommendations. If you want to relax and feel "welcomed", this hotel would be the home away home. We love the Hotel David!
reviews.title: Home away home at Hotel David

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Business colleague and myself had a call in Florence on a Friday and needed to spend a weekend before more business calls Monday in other areas of Europe. Chose Hotel David because of Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't dissapointed. Beautiful Hotel. Roomy, super clean, and nicely decorated. Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. they all spoke excellent English. We had free WIFI, so got a lot of work done in addition to enjoyning the Hotel and city. Brought our laptops down to the spacious sitting area off the main lobby and enjoyed the fire, Christmas tree, and free snacks and wine in the evening while surfing the Internet. If you are a road warrior, it doesn't get any better than this. One note is that they apparently have port 1352 blocked in their firewall which made it impossibe for us to replicate our client Lotus Notes email. This would have been a major problem for us, but we had a backup access to email through a web client. Everything else in this Hotel was so perfect, that I didn't have the heart to even mention this issue to the staff. One last note....It is a 20 minute walk along the river to the museums and shopping, but that in itself is invigorating. This shouldn't stop you from booking this Hotel if you are in good health. I can't wait to bring my wife and kids back here!
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Business Too
Great service + delicious breakfast + Comfortable room
reviews.text: We have stayed in Hotel David for 4 nights during our stay in Florence from Nov 19- Nov 23, 2007. I have booked this hotel because it ranked No 3 on Tripadvisor. After my own experencing with it, I am very impressed by this hotel and share with all the others who gave the best review to this Hotel. The staffs are very resourceful and detail oriented. They had advised us for the tours, directions, transportaions, good restaurant etc. Anyway, whenever you are not sure of going somewhere in Florence, check with the Hotel David's front-desk staffs first. Also, you do not need to carry your key, the front desk will take care of it for you. Plus, they also sell bus tickets which are very convenient.

The location is a bit out of the center, but the front desk will draw a very good map of the different busses that stop out front. Our room was beautiful and spotless with an amazing bathroom. We enjoyed the evening snacks and wine, and loved the breakfast each morning. The two restaurants recommended by the front desk were wonderful. Would highly recommend the Hotel David.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If going to Florence, I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. Friendly staff, air conditioning (which is a must in Florence), good breakfasts and pre-dinner drinks in the garden (as outlined in previous reviews) all contributed to a wonderful 5-day holiday. To get to the hotel from the main railway station, take a "D" bus, which will only cost just over 1 euro and stops right outside the hotel. I would also recommend visiting Fiesole (on a number 7 bus - also costing just over 1 euro) and heading for the viewpoint near a convent above the town for a wonderful view of Florence below. The only down side to Florence was the number of mosquitos but the bites were worth it!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel David the week before we were married in Fiesole (Last week of May '07). It was the perfect location. Within walking distance of the center of Florence but out of the way enough to be quiet and relaxing. The room we had was beautiful - huge by comparison to other European hotels I've stayed in!! I loved the little computer nook! And the staff was just amazing! My husband and I wanted a quiet, personal wedding so it was just the two of us traveling. The day of the wedding as we checked out we learned there was a taxi strike! I was not thrilled but was ready to endure a bus ride with dress in tow to where we were getting married in Fiesole. The owner of the hotel however would not hear of it and personally drove my husband and I to Fiesole. They also gave us a bottle of champagne in celebration of our marriage!! We would recommend this hotel to anyone and we can not wait to go back!

It is a bit of a walk into the city but walking in Florence is no effort. Regular bus drops you off outside hotel if you're tired.

There could be a bit of a queue.This also meant that when the buffet was running low it was not replenished that often. I was unaware at first, but you could order an esspresso or cappucino from this one woman if you managed to catch her between jobs. We went to the cafe next door for a very nice and cheap coffee and danish on the last two days. My tip would be to eat and drink relatively near the hotel as the prices are nowhere near those in the city. Coffee in the City £5, outside hotel £0.90

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two couples recently stayed four nights at the Hotel David in Florence. We had visited Florence previously. This hotel is not in the city center and we were really happy about that. The neighborhood was lovely and the setting was quiet. Cabs are not expensive in Florence and the bus into downtown was easy to access and very cheap. The hotel is well maintained and spacious. My husband and I had a very large room that included a twin bed in case we had needed a triple room. The bathroom was very nice. We had a minibar in our room and all of the contents were free. Each room had individual controls for the air conditioning and the AC actually worked! The AC was the absolute best of the 4 hotels that we stayed in during our 2 week trip to France and Italy. The hotel had a hot breakfast each morning that was delicious. Additionally a happy hour took place each evening from 6:30-8PM and included nice snacks and wine. The staff was wonderful. Their English was quite good and they were knowledgeable and helpful. They handled all of our dinner reservations and secured cabs for us when needed. This is a jewel of a hotel and I would gladly stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

Though our room faced a very busy thoroughfare, the windows and shades (which are drawn electronically) insulated us from any street noise. We slept very comfortably. The air conditioning was excellent. The bathroom, very smartly decorated and immacuate, was a bit on the small side as it had limited places to put things. No big deal though. The shower was really excellent. Lots of constant hot water, good pressure from the shower head.

likes.disliked: — Location was a bit too far from the tourist areas

reviews.title: Would automatically stay again when next in Florence
reviews.text: The front desk service was truly extraordinary. Everyone was extremely friendly and exceedingly helpful. They made excellent restaurant recommendations near the hotel as well as in the downtown area.

reviews.title: Warm and welcoming hotel in busy Florence
reviews.text: If you don't enjoy walking, but want to be near the Duomo, it is a bit of a hike from the hotel (maybe 40 minutes). This could be a problem if you want to go back and forth from the hotel. It's not that far to the Ponto Vecchio (about 20 minutes each way), but after a long day of walking, going back to the Duomo area for dinner can be daunting. A cab ride from Hotel David on a busy Saturday/Sunday night can be 18+ euros one way. Fortunately there are a lot of good neighborhood restaurants that the hotel can recommend, many of which are located just down the street from the hotel or about a 5-7 block walk outside the old city walls. You can also take the city buses to and from the Duomo. Hotel gave instructions on how to do this.

description: Just a short walk to the historic center or to the surrounding green hills, the Hotel David in Florence is a perfect place to begin and end the day in one of the world's most beautiful cities.
